body: Deliberately held at 1.x - so we can switch between webjar version 1.x and 2.x - once we know 2.x is stable, we can remove the 1.x dependency.

Simply purging the cloned Spring Graph-QL classes, left us with a 
```
No qualifying bean of type 'org.springframework.graphql.execution.BatchLoaderRegistry' available
```

So we provide a fallback default with `IsisModuleIncViewerGraphqlViewer`.
Let's merge it, we can fix up GraphQL if needed later.  Would rather not block the upgrade.

NOT A BUG

Actually the removal of "editable" Collections was intentional! See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ISIS-3084.

Anyway thanks for looking into this, contributions are appreciated!

You might also consider to contact the community via Slack. See
https://isis.apache.org/docs/2.0.0-M7/support/slack-channel.html

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`. You can also ignore all major, minor, or patch releases for a dependency by adding an [`ignore` condition](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#ignore) with the desired `update_types` to your config file.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`. You can also ignore all major, minor, or patch releases for a dependency by adding an [`ignore` condition](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#ignore) with the desired `update_types` to your config file.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

I think we can model the dirty state in `org.apache.isis.core.metamodel.interactions.managed.ParameterNegotiationModel` instead, by introducing an additional BooleanObservable. Also we should be able modify behavior as intended, without touching any of the Wicket Viewer code. I'll help with that!
I checked out this branch doing a little bit of refactoring.

pre-store event fixes
object mementos simplified a lot

wicket viewer 'execution' still broken as was before the branch-off

Thanks for spotting that. As this is a built site (using antora) I believe the link should be rather some generic `xref: ...` reference, that antora autoresolves. In other words we should not need site internal static links of sort `https://isis.apache.org/conguide/version-xxx/contributing.html`

UPDATE: I got confused: the file in question here is not part of the antora build, so xref:.. won't work.
Actually, we are on M8 now, so the patch isn't quite correct.
@HeVictor could you update the link to 'M8', then I'm happy to merge.
Looks like org.webjars.bowergithub.mozilla:pdfjs-dist is no longer a dependency, so this is no longer needed.
@andi-huber Apologies for the late response but I wasn't able to get back to this until now, but I see you've made the required change already which is great. Thanks for taking care of it.
No worries. Thanks for your contribution regardless.

@andi-huber Thanks for reviewing my PR so quickly! Incidentally, I'm participating in [Hacktoberfest](https://hacktoberfest.com/about/) at the moment which is an event that encourages people to contribute to open-source projects in October through PR's. Would it be alright for you to add a `hacktoberfest-accepted` label to this PR to count it towards my contribution for the event?
Thanks for the approval @andi-huber! Would I be able to get the `hacktoberfest-accepted` label on this PR again to count towards my participation in [Hacktoberfest](https://hacktoberfest.com/about/)?
I guess it's fine to do this rename incrementally, but the isis-nightly build will need a script that can do everything in one go (though can probably ignore regression tests).
Agreed. I want to do the rename to 'causeway' in a more controlled manner. And also preserve the git history, if possible.
just updated the goals, there are 2 further modules in the incubator (graphql and commandreplay)
just artifacts and packages - doing class renaming separately
